sources.full_text_concat:
Ātmabodhaprakaraṇa of Śaṅkarācārya with a commentary ascribed
                        to Mahusūdana Sarasvatī
                    Edited with an introduction and notes by Dinesh Chandra
                        Bhattacharya, Sāstrī, Tarka-Vedānta-tīrtha.
                    Dinesh Chandra Bhaṭṭācārya
                    Sanskrit College
                    Calcutta
                    1961
                    This SARIT edition omits the preface and introduction from
                        this edition.

sources.full_text_concat:
Sanskrit-College-Library-Manuscript
                    Ātmabodhaṭīkā
                    Written in clear Bengali script on machine-made paper. It contains 17
                                folia (34 pages) of 10.75" x 4" size, each page containing 6 lines.
                                It contains only the commentary entitled Ātmabodhaṭīkā without the
                                text of Ātmabodha. No name of the author or the scribe is mentioned
                                anywhere. It is full of misreadings and omissions.

India-Office-Library-Manuscript
                    Ātmabodhaprakaraṇaṃ saṭīkam
                    This is microfilm copy of the manuscript deposited in the India
                                Office Library, London. The manuscript its numbered as--Sanskrit
                                2296. Egg 2296, I.O. 2011a, and bears the title Ātmabodhaprakaraṇaṃ
                                saṭīkam. It contains both the text and the commentary of the
                                Ātmabodha. It is complete in 16 folia with 10 to 12 lines on each
                                page. It is written in Devanāgarī script without any mention of
                                date, author or scribe. But a colophon with Śaṅkarācārya's name as
                                the author of the Ātmabodha appears at the end.

content.value:
Ātmabodhaprakaraṇa transcribed by Weiwei Wu on the basis of
                    Dinesh Chandra Bhattacharya's 1961 Calcutta edition
The International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration

). IAST differs
                    in small ways from ISO 15919, but is preferred by most working Sanskrit
                    scholars. Conversion of this file to ISO 15919 can be achieved by performing the
                    following replacements throughout the file:
Text division is as Devanāgarī ("ityevam" not "ity evam".)

children.text:
The upaniṣads, the Gīta and the Brahmasūtras are called
                            the three prasthānas, on which Śaṅkara wrote commentaries. IM omits from

nuṣṭhānarūpaistapobhiḥ
                        kṣīṇāni pāpāni rāgādyantaḥkaraṇadoṣā yeṣāṃ teṣāṃ, nityanaimittikaireva
                        kurvāṇo duritakṣayamiti vacanāt

This portion of the verse
                            is found quoted by the different commentators.
pākasya vahnivajjñānaṃ vinā mokṣo na sidhyati ||2||

nanu tapoyogamantrakarmayāgādyanekasādhaneṣu satsu mokṣaṃ prati bodha eva
                        kimiti prādhānyena ucyate ityata

jñānadvārā
                        mokṣaṃ sādhayanti, jñānantu svajanmamātrādevājñānaṃ niḥśeṣaṃ nāśayitvā
                        mumukṣuṃ svārājye'bhiṣecayati, ato'nyasādhanebhyo jñānasya prādhānyamuktam
                        |

sidhyati tadvat
                        jñānaṃ vinā mokṣo na sidhyatītyartha ||2||

tyāśaṃkya
                                karmājñānayorvirodhābhāvānnaivamityāha--avirodhīti |
                                karmaṇo'vidyāvirodhitvābhāvādajñānaṃ nāśayituṃ notsahate vidyāyāḥ
                                prakāśarūpatvādaṃdhaṃ tamastejapuñjamiva nāśayituṃ samartha
                                ityarthaḥ

which is
                            evidently a misreading. IM reads

ātmā kevala eva prakāśate
                        meghāvaraṇābhāve bhānuvadityarthaḥ ||4||

ekībhavati; tadānīmadvaya evātmā prakāśate,
                        yathā katakareṇurakhilaṃ jalaṃ nirmalaṃ kṛtvā svayamapi

nanvaparokṣatayānubhūyamānasya saṃsārasya kathamatyantāsattvaṃ
                        pratyakṣavirūddhamityāśaṃkya svapnadṛṣṭāntena tasya

svasya kāraṇabhūtājñāne sthite sati
                        tāvanmithyābhūto'pi saṃsāraḥ sannevāvabhāti

yāvannidrānubhūyate tāvanmithyābhūto'pi
                        satya iva bhāti, prabodhe nidrānāśe sati svapno mithyā bhavati, tadvat
                        saṃsāra ityarthaḥ

tathā sarvādhiṣṭḥānabhūtaṃ
                        saccidānandādvayaṃ brahma yāvanna jñāyate sākṣānnānubhūyate

This
                                    verse is numbered as the eighth in Vanivilas and other editions
                                    of Atmabodha. But none of our manuscripts (SM and IM) contains
                                    the verse or any commentary on it. So, it seems that some
                                    manuscripts of Atmabodha did not include this verse, and counted
                                    the next verse as eighth and so on. We, however, include the
                                    verse though without any commentary, and number the verses
                                    accordingly.

devatiryaṅnarasthāvarajaṅgamādayo'pi
                        vividhā api vyaktayaḥ sarvopādānabhūte parameśvare hātāke

hemni
                        kaṭakamukuṭādaya iva kalpitā eva, brahmaṇo'bhinnā ityarthaḥ ||9||
IM and SM count this verse as '8' and so on.

niyāmako vā,
                            vibhuḥ sarvagataḥ parameśvaraḥ svamāyākalpita

, tannāśe sati brahmātmaikyajñānena
                            taṣāṃ māyāparikalpitānāṃ nāśāt

kevala eva
                            bhāti, yathākāśo ?bopādhivaśānnāneva bhāti upādhilayādeka

, yathā svabhāvamadhuraṃ jalaṃ
                        kaṭukaṣāyāmlaraktapītādidravyopetaṃ sat tadrupaṃ bhajati

tatraikaikamardhaṃ caturdhā samaṃ
                        vibhacya svāṃśaṃ parityacyetareṣu yojanaṃ pañcīkaraṇam; evaṃ pañcīkṛtebhyaḥ
                        sthūlapṛthivyādimahābhūtebhyaḥ sambhavo yasya tat karmasaṃcitaṃ

pañcaprāṇā ekasyaiva mahāprāṇasya prāṇādayo vṛttayaḥ,
                        jñānendriyakarmendriyabhedenendriyāṇi daśa, manaḥśabdena
                            saṃkalpavikalpātmakāntaḥkaraṇavṛtti

buddhirniścayātmikā,
                        etaiḥ saṃyuktamapañcīkṛtasūkṣmabhūtoththaṃ sūkṣmabhūtebhyo jātaṃ sūkṣmāṅgaṃ
                        liṅgaśarīraṃ sukhaduḥkhabhogasādhanamityarthaḥ

kāraṇopādhirūcyate,
                        sā ca vyaṣṭisamaṣṭibhedena sthūlasūkṣmaprapañcayoḥ kāraṇabhūtatvāt
                        kāraṇopādhirūcyate |

nanvannamayādyeṣu koṣeṣu vyāpya tattanmayatayā sthitasya kuto
                            nityamuktatva

dīnāṃ grahaṇam, etauryogena
                        mithyātādātmyena tattanmaya iva sthita ātmā śuddho

sa vā eṣa
                        puruṣo'nnarasamaya ityādibhiḥ sūkṣmavastudarśanārthamevopādhisthaṃ brahma
                        sūcayati na tu tattvadṛṣṭyā, yathā nirmalasphaṭiko nīlapītavastrādiyogena
                        tattanmaya iva bhāti

etc. The logical
                            connection in the verse seems to be a bit difficult. The readings in the
                            commentary of both the Mss. render no meaning. So some words have been
                            inserted in the commentary for the logical connection and
                            meaning.

taṇḍulamiva pañcakoṣaistāvat sthitamāntaramātmānaṃ
                        yuktyavadhātataḥ yuktirūpāvahananāt śuddhaṃ viviñcyāt

kathamayaṃ sthūladehavadityanumānādibhyaḥ kośebhyo bhinnamātmānaṃ
                                vivicya jānīyādityarthaḥ |

IM reads the second
                                    line as--

nanvātmā sarvagatastarhi kiṃ sarvatra sarvairna dṛśyate ityatrāha--sadā
                        sarvagata iti |

na sarvatra, yathā pratibimbaḥ
                        svaccheṣveva darpaṇādiṣu dṛśyate nānyatra tadvadityarthaḥ ||17||

mātmānaṃ tadvṛttīnāṃ sākṣitayā sthitaṃ, yathā rājā svanagare sthito
                        mantriṣu pravartamāneṣu svayaṃ sākṣitayā tān paśyan

nanvātmano'vikāritvamayuktaṃ yataḥ sarvadā vyāpāravān dṛśyate,
                        tatrāha--vyāpṛteṣviti |

vyāpṛteṣu satsu ātmā
                        vyāpārīvāvivekināṃ guruśāstrādyupadeśarahitānāṃ dṛśyate na tu tattvadṛśām
                        |

yathā meghakhaṇḍeṣu vāyuvaśād dhāvatsu candro'pi dhāvatīva lokairdṛśyate na
                        tu candramā dhāvati tathā ātmāpītyarthaḥ ||19||

vartante, yathā
                        prāṇinaḥ sūryaprakāmāśritya svavyāpāreṣu vyavaharanti |
SM omits this portion but reads

ātmacaitanyena ātmajñānena dehendriyādayo'pi
                                jñāninaḥ, vastuto jñānamātmanyeva

dehendriyamanobuddhidharmāścaturṇāṃ sattvādīn karmāṇi ca karmendriyavyāpārān
                        mithyātādātmyena sthite'male'saṅgarūpe

saccidānandātmake paramātmanyeva
                        etatsāmīpyādavivekato'dhasyanti yathā gagane nīlatādi |
ataste ātmadharmā na bhavanti kintu dehādīnāmevetyarthaḥ ||21||

ajñānānmānasopādhe stasyaiva
                        kartṛtvādayo dharmā atattvajñānavaśādātmani kalpyante,
                        yathāmbhasaścalanādikamambuni pratiphalite
katham? jāgratsvapnayorbuddhau satyāṃ rāgādi pravartate, susuptau tasyā

yathā prakāśa evārkasya svabhāvaḥ, toyasya śaityam, agneruṣṇatā tathātmano'pi
                        saccidānandanityanirmalatā svabhāvaḥ svarūpamityarthaḥ ||24||

yadyavikāryātmā tarhi jānāmīti pratyayaḥ kathamityapekṣāyāmāha--ātmana iti
                        |

saccidaṃśaḥ, aṃśa ivāṃśa ātmābhāso
                        buddhivṛttiścaitadda yamavivekena saṃyojya,

yadyapyasaṅgasyātmanaḥ kenāpi saṃyogo nāstyeva
                        tathāpyajñānavaśānmelanaṃ saṃbhāvya, jānāmīti pratyayo'haṃkāravṛttiḥ
                        pravartate |
ātmano vikriyā nāsti buddherbodho na jātviti |
jīvaḥ sarvamalaṃ jñātvā jñātā draṣṭeti muhyati ||26||

sarvaṃ
                                sābhāsāntaḥkaraṇavṛttināṃ taptāyaḥpiṇḍavadekatra saṃgatya
                                tamevālamatyarthaṃ jñātvā dehendriyādikamahamiti vicāryāhaṃ kartāhaṃ
                                draṣṭeti muhyati |

in the sloka should be
                            connected with
rajjusarpavadātmānaṃ jīvaṃ jñāvaṃ jñātvā bhayaṃ vahet |

yathā mandāndhakārādau sarpāropaṃ kṛtvā bhayakampādikaṃ vahedevamātmāpi
                        svasmin jīvatvamāropya svaṃ sadvitīyaṃ paricchinnaṃ jñātvā bhayaṃ vahed

mutpannaṃ bhavati tadā vivekacakṣuṣā
                        svamātmānamakhaṇḍānandajñānaikarūpaṃ saṃpaśyan tato nāhaṃ jīvaḥ
                        paramātmā'hamiti jñātvā

eva sannapi
                        buddhimano'haṃkārādīnyavabhāsayati, tai jaḍairmanādibhirātmā nāvabhāsyate,
                        yathā eka eva dīpo ghaṭādīn sarvānapyavabhāsayati, tai

ātmā buddhyahaṃkārādibhirnāvabhāsyate yadi tarhi ātmajñāne jñānāntareṇa
                        bhavitavyamityāśaṃkyāha--svabodhe iti

ātmano bodharūpatvāt svabodhe nitye sati, tasyātmano bodhāya jñānāntarāpekṣā
                        nāstyeva, anubhavarūpatvāt,

yadi buddhyādibhirātmā jñēyo na bhavet tarhi ātmajñāne upāyāntaraṃ vācyam, sa
                        upāyaḥ ka ityāha--niṣidhyeti |

ātmasvarūpajñāne atannirasanābhāve kā kṣatirityāśaṃkya atannirasanābhāve ātmā
                        jñātumaśakyaḥ, yathā nāyaṃ sarpa ityāropitasyāpakaraṇābhāve

dehendriyādi sarvaṃ dṛśyajātamāvidyakaṃ dṛśyatvāt, budbudavat kṣaraṃ
                        naśvaram, etadvilakṣaṇaṃ nirmalaṃ nirupādhikaṃ nityamekaṃ
                            saccidānandātmakaṃ
athamindriyaprāṇamanasā nāvabhāsate ityāśaṃkya śrutiṃ pramāṇayati aprāṇa

with the No.33. Hence
                            subsequent numbers of IM tally with our numbers, which were ahead by one
                            up to this, due to inclusion of verse No. 8.
ahaṃ nirguṇo buddhyabhāvāt, niṣkriya indriyādyabhāvāt, nityo'parokṣatvāt

which are evidently misreadings.
                            The reading might possibly be

, nirañjano'saṅgatvāt,
                        nirvikāro niravayavatvāt, nityamukto bandhābhāvāt,
                        nirmalo'vidyātatkāryarahitatvāt ||34||

viśiṣṭaṃ svarūpaṃ jñānasiddhamiti,
                                muktvetat kimiti viśiṣṭam
bahirantargato'cyutaḥ cyutirahitaḥ, sadā sarvasamo viṣameṣvapi samatayā

vyāpya sthitaḥ, tathā śuddho nirlepaḥ, acalaḥ
                        pūrṇasya calanābhāvāt
satyaṃ jñānamanantaṃ yat paraṃ brahmāhameva tat ||36||

The commentator
                            seems to take the readings as

satyaṃ jñānamanantaṃ yat paraṃ brahmeti
                            śrutyā

evamuktaprakāreṇa brahmaivāhamasmīti nairantaryeṇa cirakālābhyastā kāsanā
                        avidyākṛtavikṣepānniḥśeṣato nāśayati, yathā rasāyanamauṣadhaṃ
                        cirakālasevitaṃ sad

deśe āsīnaḥ sukhopaviṣṭaḥ,
                        virāgaḥ sarvatra gatābhilāṣo'ta eva nirjitānīndriyāṇi yena saḥ,
                        anantamaparicchinnamekamadvayaṃ tamātmānam, ananyadhīrbrahmaṇyeva sthitā
                        niścayātmikā buddhiryasya tādṛśo bhāvayeddhyāyet ||38||

akhilaṃ dṛśyajātaṃ sudhīḥ śuddhāntaḥkaraṇaḥ san śuddhayā dhiyā ātmanyeva
                        samādhisamaye pravilāpya prakarṣeṇa nāśayitvā tadā dvitīyābhāvādekamātmānaṃ
                            sajyotiṣkākāśavad

SM reads something unintelligible.
                            IM reads

paramārthadarśī munirnāmarūpavarṇādikaṃ sarvaṃ vihāya paripūrṇajñānānandarūpa
                        evāvatiṣṭhate ityata āha--rūpavarṇādikamiti

mātrāditripuṭijñānaṃ
                        vartamānamupalabhyate kathamekatvabhāvanetyāśaṃkya paramātmani bhedo
                        nāstyevetyāha--jñātriti |

jñātrādibhedaḥ
                                paramātmani na vidyate, sa bhedaḥ
                        kalpita.

jñātṛjñānajñeyabhedaḥ kalpita ātmanyababhāti,
                        jñānānandaikarupatvādātmā svayameva dīpyate

Here both the
                            manuscripts are confused and incorrect in their readings; so, the
                            possible correct reading has been given.

dhyānena tayormathane
                        sarvadā kṛte tatroditā jvālārūpāvagatirjñānaṃ

niḥśeṣataḥ saparikaraṃ nāśayati; tadā
                        mumukṣuḥ svārājyo'bhiṣiktaḥ kṛtakṛtyo bhavatītyarthaḥ ||42||

ātmā sarvadā parokṣasvabhāvatvādaprāpta eva, sa ātmā kadā prāpto bhavediti
                        śiṣyābhiprāyamāśaṃkyāha

ātmā sarvatra pūrṇo'dvayānandarūpaḥ sarvadā prāpta evāvidyāvaśād bhrāntyā
                        aprāpta ivābhāti, tannāśe tadāvaraṇāvidyānāśe vākyaśravaṇāt prāpta
jīvasya tāttvike rūpe tasmin dṛṣṭe nivartate ||45||

yathāndhakārasthite sthāṇau puruṣo'yamiti
                        coraśaṃkayā bibhyati tathaivāvicārāt brahmaṇi jīvatvamāropyate, tathā

ahaṃ mameti pratyaye jāgrati kathaṃ nāhamiti pratyaya ityāśaṃkya tadapi
                        tathaiva mṛṣā ityāha--tattvasvarūpeti |

yajjñānaṃ tadahaṃ mametyajñānaṃ bādhate, digbhramādivaditi
                        bhānudarśanādityarthaḥ ||46||

ahaṃ mameti pratyaye naṣṭe yogī samyagvivekavān san vijñānena cakṣuṣā sarvaṃ
                        dṛśyaṃ prapañcaṃ svātmanyevānubhavena paśyatītyāha--samyagiti |
ekamātmānaṃ sarvaṃ paśyati, tadā tadrūpo bhavatīti bhāvaḥ
SM omits the whole of this commentary and only reads

nanvātmā sarva na bhavati pratyakṣavirodhāt, nānātvena dṛśyamānamidaṃ
                            sarvaṃ

idaṃ sarvaṃ jagadātmaivātmakāryatvādato'nyadātmano na kiñcidvidyate, yathā
                        ghaṭaśarāvādikāryaṃ

ataḥ svātmanyeva sarvaṃ dṛśyajātamabhedenekṣate paśyati, vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro
                        nāmadheyaṃ mṛttiketyeva satyamiti śruteḥ

anādyavidyāparikalpitapūrvopādhiṃ dehamanobuddhyādīn guṇān sattvādīn
                        parityajet, tadaiva

moha eva arṇavo'paryantatvāt, taṃ jñānaplavena tīrtvā niḥśeṣaṃ nāśayitvā,
                        rāgadveṣādaya eva rākṣasā mokṣaparipanthinaḥ,

tān
                        niḥśeṣato nāśayitvā śāntisamāyuktaḥ śamadamādisahita ātmārāma ātmanyeva

krīḍā yasya sa virājate
                        svārājyenābhiṣiktaḥ prakāśate |

samurdra tīrtvā
                        rāvaṇādirākṣasān itvā, sītā eva
jale jalaṃ viyadvomni tejastojasi vā yathā ||53||

upādhibhūtadehadvayalaye prārabdhakarmakṣaye muniryogī viṣṇau sarvavyāpake
                        parabrahmaṇi nirviśeṣaṃ yathā bhavet tathā viśet |

yadbrahmasākṣātkāralābhādaparo lābho na vidyate sarvalābhānām
                            tatraivāntarbhāvāt

yathā brahmānande
                        kṣudrānandānāmantarbhāvaḥ, yatsukhādbrahmānubhavasukhādaparaṃ sukhaṃ nāsti
                        niratiśayasukhatvāt, yajjñānād brahmasākṣātkārajñānādaparaṃ jñānaṃ nāsti
                        mokṣahetutvāt, brahmeti tajjānīyāt ||54||
yaddṛṣṭvā nāparaṃ dṛśyaṃ yadbhūtvā na punarbhavaḥ |

draṣṭavyaṃ nāsti tenaiva puruṣārthasya
                        siddhatvāt, yadbhūtvā

rjanmādikaṃ nāsti, yajjñātvā
                        yatsvarūpaṃ jñātvānyajjñeyaṃ nāsti, tadeva brahmetyavadhārayet |

yasya tasya
                        ānandaleśamāśritya brahmendrādayo'pyānandino bhavanti ānandatāratamyeṇa,
                        etasyaivānandasyānyāni bhūtāni mātrāmupajīvantītyādiśruteḥ
tasmāt sarvagataṃ brahma anantaṃ priyaṃ, yathā kṣīraṃ sarvaṃ vyāpya

tarhyātmā kena prakāreṇa sarvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhatītyāśaṃkya
                        sākṣādvaktumaśakyatvādanaṇu asthūlamiti śruteḥ
Bṛhadāraṇyakopaniṣad--3.8. But the reading should be

bhāsyate, na tatra sūryo bhāti na candratārakaṃ nemā vidyuto bhānti
                        kṛto'yamagnistameva bhāntamanubhāti sarvaṃ tasya bhāsā sarvamidaṃ vibhātīti
                            śruteḥ

; yena sarvamidaṃ
                        bhūtabhautikabhāvarūpaṃ jagatbhāti tadbrahmeti jānīyāt ||61||

taptāyaḥpiṇḍavat svayamevāntarbahirvyāpya
                        bhāsayannakhilaṃ brahma prakāśate ityāha svayamantariti spaṣṭo'rthaḥ
sarvaṃ brahmaiva satyaṃ; tathāpi jagadrupeṇa yadā

vicāryate cettadā jñātuṃ śakyaṃ
                        brahmaṇo'nyanna vidyate

cakṣuṣā ca
                                dṛśyate śrotreṇā śruyate yanmanasā smaryate yacca vācā
                                abhidhīyate
śrutiśca--na cakṣuṣā gṛhyate nāpi vācā nānyairdevaistapasā karmaṇā vā |
jñānaprasādena viśuddhasattvastatastu taṃ paśyati niṣkalaṃ dhyāyamāna

Muṇḍakopaniṣad (3.1). Insertion of this Upaniṣad text and
                            the following two lines seem somewhat redundant.

sarvaiḥ kiṃ na dṛśyate
                        ityāśaṃkya cakṣurādibhirna gṛhyate iti tat śrutyā
IM reads some unintelligible words and then reads

yo'jñānacakṣuḥ sa
                        sarvagamapi saccidānandaṃ brahma na paśyapi yathā prakāśamānamapi
                        bhānumandho na paśyati; jñānaprasādena jñānacakṣuṣā sarvatra brahmaiva
                        paśyatītyarthaḥ ||65||

evaṃ
                        tāvaduktarītyānubhavasampannasyāpi tadabhyāsarahitasya vāsanāvaśāt
                        kiñcidajñānaṃ sambhavati tatparihārārthaṃ punaḥ śravaṇādikaṃ

śravaṇamananādibhiruccairdīptaḥ
                        prakāśita jñānamevāgnistena paritāpitaḥ parito viśeṣataśca śodhita
                            ityarthaḥ

svarṇam upādhikṛtaṃ durvaṇādi hitvā svarūpeṇa
                                prakāśate tadvadityarthaḥ.

eva bhānuḥ, sarvasyādhāramūtatvāt sarvavyāpī
                        sarvadhārī ca, śeṣaṃ spaṣṭam ||67||

haratīti śītādihṛt,
                        nityasukhaṃ mokṣānandaprāpakatvāt, itaratīrtheṣu tadviparītaṃ draṣṭavyam

tasmādātmatīrthe snātasya na kiñcidavaśiṣyat iti bhāvaḥ ||68||
